greetingSubtitle: Global fetch and test runner in Node 18 — this might be the main news in today's issue of SetTimeout, developer.

cards.title: Finding Cross Browser Compatibility Issues in HTML and CSS
cards.description: Cross-browser compatibility bugs are inevitable for any web project, regardless of its development platform. But, before you handle them you need to find out the errors first.
cards.author: Deeksha Agarwal

cards.title: More to give than just the div: semantics and how to get them right
cards.description: When used right, HTML helps us build websites and apps that work for a broad range of users. Let’s look at what semantics are and how to get them right.
cards.author: Hidde de Vries

cards.title: Building Web Layouts For Dual-Screen And Foldable Devices
cards.description: Dual screen and foldable devices are just the next step in responsive design, so they’re viewed as another responsive design target that we can style for with media features.
cards.author: Stephanie Stimac

cards.title: Node.js 18 is now available!
cards.description: Global fetch and test runner seems to be the most interesting experimental features of new current version of Node. Read official release post to get more information.
cards.author: Node.js project

cards.title: Clojure meets Dart in ClojureDart
cards.description: A port of Clojure that compiles to Dart, ClojureDart aims to extend the use of Clojure to mobile and desktop applications.
cards.author: Paul Krill

cards.title: React 18 - New Features & Improvement Strategies
cards.description: Let's talk a little more about React 18. Here are the latest changes with practical examples.
cards.author: Bidisha Das

cards.title: How to build faster animation transitions in React
cards.description: React Transition Hooks is a library similar to the popular react-transition-group , but it’s lightweight, has simpler syntaxes, and is more performant.
cards.author: David Omotayo

cards.title: Meet RxJS: Your Best Friend in Angular in 2022
cards.description: RxJS is a library for reactive programming using Observables, to make it easier to compose asynchronous or callback-based code. In this article, you will learn how to optimize your application with some of these operators.
cards.author: DevJo
